title: Riot please add # of dragons killed in post game stats
body:
As a jungle main, I have always put an emphasis on dragon control, as every jungler should. I know during the game it is easy to see which dragons will spawn and which have been killed by each team. I love that, however there is nothing to show that in post game stats. I figure if vision score is there for supports, then dragon score should be there for junglers. Relative easy fix for an self analytical jungler.

Please and thank you!
AmericanAfrican

replies.body:
EDITED, BECAUSE I FAILED TO FULLY UNDERSTAND!

I see what you mean now, in the Stats page. I'll ping the relevant team as a suggestion, but I imagine that attributing the "dragon kill" to one champion alone, seems a bit unfair. Especially if the jungler whittles it down to almost nothing, and then your evil teammates take the final shot.

Original comment:
I hope I'm understanding this right (because I am also a jg main). I can see the dragons that each team killed in the match history (below).

https://i.imgur.com/8CFMZtu.png

Also, in the Overview tab in Match History, you can see which drakes spawn, when, and who killed them.
I would prefer to implement it as dragon "takedowns". kills and assists should count towards dragon kills.

Thank you for pointing out that the information is available after I open up again in match history. I didnt know that was there. Im just hoping we can have similar features in post game lobby so I can brag about my 4 dragon kills. lol
I second Crett's comment, don't attribute kills but count takedowns.
woah woah woah. Vision score is not just there for supports!
